caption.p:
Seeking evidence from sedimentary δ 15N
org records. Shading depicts the simulated change in δ 15N of organic matter as a result of increasing aeolian Fe supply from the modern to a glacial rate. Solid and dashed contour lines mark simulated differences of 1 and −1. Circles mark locations of sediment cores where bulk organic matter was analysed for δ 15N, while stars mark locations where either foraminifera- or diatom-bound δ 15N was measured. The colour of the markers is an estimate of the glacial (Last Glacial Maximum: 20,000–26,000 BCE) minus interglacial (Late Holocene: 0–5000 BCE) difference in δ 15N
org , with red colours representing higher values and blues representing lower values in the glacial ocean. Sedimentary record data are provided in Supplementary Data 1
